text: have you always wanted to grill fruit
but weren't sure how to go about doing
it well today I'm gonna share with you
some tricks and tips for grilling fruit
you can do it indoors you can do it
outdoors and you will have success every
single time you can grill so many
different fruits let your imagination go
wild I have bananas in front of me
watermelon is also really great on the
grill if you haven't tried it give it a
try
peaches or other stone fruit like plums
nectarines would be really great apples
and pears are really wonderful on the
grill as well pineapple we all know and
love grilled pineapple and of course
mango is really great on the grill so
today I'm gonna do I think a little bit
of watermelon I'm gonna grill a banana
and I'm gonna do a peach so I'm going to
cut the banana in half lengthwise and
I'm going to keep it in its jacket or in
the skin and what this will do is it
will help to protect the structure of
the fruit bananas are a little bit
softer and texture than a lot of other
fruits that I have here so it really
help when you grill inside the skin now
all you need is a little bit of fat I'm
going to use a little bit of safflower
oil a high heat neutral oil brush
lightly the banana and then I have a
grill pan I'm indoors today but of
course you could apply the same
technique to grilling outdoors using
direct heat I have my grill on high heat
right now place the bananas cut side
down and you really don't want to mess
with the bananas once they go on to the
grill don't move them don't turn them
give them a good amount of time about
three minutes to get a really great sear
so you get those wonderful grill marks
so same thing with the peaches you could
also use butter here clarified butter is
really great as well so just brush the
peach and I'm actually going to flip the
peach so i'll brush the entire thing
with a little bit of butter again high
high heat and we'll go back to the oil
for the watermelon now whenever you're
grilling fruit try to cut the fruit in a
bigger sized piece because the bigger
the piece the less likely it is to fall
in the grates of your grill if you're
grilling outdoor
and also since what's happening the
structure of the fruit is changing all
of those sugars are caramelizing and
weakening the structure of the fruit so
the bigger the pieces the more sturdy
they'll be and will be able to be
grilled successfully so bigger is better
in this case now it's been a few minutes
the bananas look like they're getting a
nice color here and I think these are
ready for a flip let's see here
oh they look great the bananas look
great now another three minutes on the
other side so that the fruit has the
opportunity to cook through watermelon
looks good and there is the peach so
another three minutes so when choosing
your fruit for grilling you want to make
sure in terms of the ripeness of the
fruit that it's right before you would
eat it as is you want the fruit to be
slightly firm so that it holds up on the
grill if you have really really ripe
fruit you're not gonna have that much
success in grilling it so I'm gonna let
these cook and then some really clever
ways in which to serve grilled fruit so
it's been three minutes the fruit looks
perfectly grilled and now you know what
do you do with grilled fruit when you're
done with it how can you pair it with
things well with peaches I love peaches
sweet or savory and they go really well
when they're grilled with pork chops
chicken anything like that
so serve that up watermelon is really
fun to serve with a little bit of feta
cheese as a salad
especially in the summertime when it's
nice and hot out you can take some basil
or mint would be really great here just
kind of toss the leaves if you have a
little bit of olive oil that would be
great some flaky sea salt and a little
bit of pepper and there you go you have
a grilled watermelon salad now for the
bananas which I'm super excited about if
you're into the whole banana split thing
this is gonna be a new take on it for
you so all you have to do is pop the
banana out of its skin
some vanilla ice cream if you're into
chocolate ice cream that would be really
great caramel ice cream would be awesome
here a sundae wouldn't be a sundae
without some chocolate sauce so a little
bit of chocolate sauce over the top here
and there you go
I think you'll be surprised at how easy
it is to grill fruit you can try it in
so many different ways so many different
recipes and flavors
there's your grilling tip guys enjoy
